intro: Dischidia cleistantha, commonly known as the climbing dischidia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is a perennial vine characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found growing on trees or rocks in humid environments. Dischidia cleistantha is known for its ability to climb and its adaptability to various soil types.
